intro: Grammitis andicola, commonly known as the Andean moss, is a small, evergreen fern native to the cloud forests of the Andes. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments on rock surfaces or in crevices. The plant has delicate, feather-like fronds that are usually less than 10 centimeters in length. It belongs to the family Hymenophyllaceae, which is characterized by its small size and intricate leaf structures. Grammitis andicola plays a role in maintaining soil stability and moisture in its high-altitude habitat.
